intro: Hiraea nutans, commonly known as the drooping hiraea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its distinctive, pendulous inflorescences. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and its flowers are typically yellow or greenish-yellow with five petals. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forest understories. The plant is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological role.
